{{wikipedia|Tsunami}}

{{ja-kanjitab|つ|なみ|yomi=k}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=つなみ|津|tr1=tsu|t1=cove, inlet, outlet|波|tr2=nami|t2=wave}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|つなみ|acc=0|acc_ref=NHK,DJR,SMK5}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{ja-l|津浪}}, {{ja-l|海嘯}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|つなみ}}

# {{lb|ja|oceanography|sort=つなみ}} a [[tsunami]], a [[tidal wave]] {{gloss|large, destructive wave generally caused by a tremendous disturbance in the ocean}}<ref>{{R:Shogakukan}}</ref>
# {{lb|ja|hydrology|less common|sort=つなみ}} a [[tidal bore]]

====Usage notes====
The {{m|ja|海嘯}} spelling is specific to the {{m|en|tidal bore}} sense.<ref name="SMK5">{{R:Shinmeikai5}}</ref>

This term is sometimes encountered as the compound {{m|ja|地震津波|tr=jishin tsunami|lit=earthquake tsunami}}, to make the meaning more explicitly clear and disambiguate from the {{m|en|tidal bore}} sense.

====Derived terms====
{{der-top}}

* {{ja-r|津波警報|つなみ けいほう}}: a [[tsunami]] [[warning]]
{{der-bottom}}
